title: Source build again takes default CUDNN over custom specified.
body_html:
Currently setup.py script appends -I/usr/local/cuda before custom CUDNN_LIB_DIR and more importantly, CUDNN_INCLUDE_DIR.

This causes pytorch to use default cudnn if there is one in /usr/local/cuda.

Simply swapping if WITH_CUDNN: block to go before if WITH_CUDA: block in setup.py solves this issue.

body:
Currently setup.py script appends -I/usr/local/cuda before custom CUDNN_LIB_DIR and more importantly, CUDNN_INCLUDE_DIR.

This causes pytorch to use default cudnn if there is one in /usr/local/cuda.

Simply swapping `if WITH_CUDNN:` block to go before `if WITH_CUDA:` block in setup.py solves this issue.
